org.dataconservancy.cos.rdf.annotations

Annotation Type IndividualUri


  • @Documented
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Inherited
 @Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface IndividualUri
    Annotates a field to be used as a resource identifier for an OWL individual. Each Java class annotated as a OwlIndividual is expected to have exactly one field annotated with IndividualUri.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Fields and Description
      static Class<? extends BiFunction> DEFAULT_TRANSFORM_FUNCTION
      Class constant identifying the default transformation function.
      static String TRANSFORM
      String constant identifying the annotation attribute transform().

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class<? extends BiFunction> transform
      Specifies a BiFunction that may be used to transform the value of the field annotated by IndividualUri.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_TRANSFORM_FUNCTION

        public static final Class<? extends BiFunction> DEFAULT_TRANSFORM_FUNCTION
        Class constant identifying the default transformation function.

      • TRANSFORM

        public static final String TRANSFORM
        String constant identifying the annotation attribute transform(). Useful when using this annotation with the Java Reflection API.

    • Element Detail

      • transform

        public abstract Class<? extends BiFunction> transform
        Specifies a BiFunction that may be used to transform the value of the field annotated by IndividualUri. By default the string value of the annotated field is returned, as if toString() was called on the value.

        BiFunction arguments

        The arguments supplied to the BiFunction are the instance of the object that has the OWL individual as a member, and the instance of the OWL individual that has this field as an annotated member.

        Given the following domain model (getters and setters elided for brevity): 

         @OwlIndividual
 public class Book {
     @IndividualUri
     String bookTitle = "Moby Dick";

     List<;Chapter> chapters;
 }

 @OwlIndividual
 public class Chapter {
     @IndividualUri
     Integer chapterNo = 1;

     List<Page> pages;
 }

 @OwlIndividual
 public class Page {
     @IndividualUri
     Integer pageId = 1;
 }

        The transform for bookTitle will receive as arguments null and an instance of Book. The transform for chapterNo will receive as arguments an instance of Book and an instance of Chapter. Finally, the transform for pageNo will receive an instance of Chapter and an instance of Page. In each case, the default transformation will return the String value of the annotated field: "Moby Dick", "1", and "1" for the Book, Chapter, and Page respectively.

        Custom transformations

        Supplying a non-default transform may be used when the value of the field must be manipulated prior to being used as a RDF resource identifier. Transforms accommodate a wide range of use cases.

        For example, assume that id in the following class contains the string form of a URL: 

         @OwlIndividual
 public class MyDomainClass {
   @IndividualUri
   String id = "http://mydomain/object/1234";
 }

        The resulting RDF model would create a resource such as: 

         <http://mydomain/object/1234> a owl:Thing ;
   # other predicates elided for brevity
   .

        A custom transformation can be implemented such that URL is decoded, and the id 1234 is used as the RDF resource identifier: 

         <1234> a owl:Thing ;
   # other predicates elided for brevity
   .

        Looking back at our previous domain model for a Page, suppose you wanted RDF resource identifiers for a Page to be hash URIs on Chapter instances: 

         <1>       a ex:Chapter .  # A Chapter individual with RDF resource ID "1"
 <1#page1> a ex:Page .     # A Page individual with RDF resource ID "1#page1"
 <1#page2> a ex:Page .     # ... with resource ID "1#page2"
        A custom transform can implement this as well.
        Returns:
        the Class of a BiFunction responsible for transforming the values to a single value used as the identifier for the OWL individual
        Default:
        org.dataconservancy.cos.rdf.support.IndividualUriTransform.class
